definition: very loudly/at the top of one's voice
to put/to place/to release/to free/to let go/to let out/to set off (fireworks)
to burst into tears/to sob loudly/to bawl

sentences.english: The moment he knows, his laugh bursts forth and makes one forgive everything.
sentences.chinese: 知曉之時，他便放聲大笑，使人原諒他的一切所爲。

sentences.english: The children were singing their hearts out on the stage.
sentences.chinese: 孩子們在舞臺上放聲歌唱。

sentences.english: Then he came back over here, and cried, easily, for two hours.
sentences.chinese: 後來他又返回那兒，放聲大哭，足足哭了兩個小時。

sentences.english: And then I fled back to my car, sat in the front seat and burst into tears.
sentences.chinese: 接着我逃回車上，坐在前面的座位上，放聲大哭。

sentences.english: Cry as loud as you can, your dreams may come back.
sentences.chinese: 放聲地呼喚吧，飄遠的夢想會歸來。

sentences.english: We had a good time and trolled all the way.
sentences.chinese: 我們玩得很高興，一路上放聲高歌。

sentences.english: Everyone in the restaurant crowded around them and started singing.
sentences.chinese: 餐廳裏的所有人都擠在他們周圍，開始放聲高歌。

sentences.english: Sing as if nobody is hearing you.
sentences.chinese: 放聲的高歌，就像沒人在傾聽一樣。

sentences.english: She could hardly restrain herself from laughing loudly. Had Lola seen it?
sentences.chinese: 她都忍不住想放聲大笑一常不知蘿拉看見了沒有？

sentences.english: I once walked past the young child of a script supervisor, and he burst into tears.
sentences.chinese: 有一次我從編劇的小孩面前走過，他立刻放聲大哭。

sentences.english: I began crying when he didn't respond.
sentences.chinese: 見他沒有反應，我放聲慟哭起來。

sentences.english: The bird seem as if they are attracted, also singing.
sentences.chinese: 小鳥彷彿被吸引住了，也放聲歌唱。

sentences.english: They all burst out laughing, sounding like a gaggle of geese.
sentences.chinese: 她們全都放聲大笑，像一羣鵝一樣嘎嘎地叫着。

sentences.english: Start singing at the top of your lungs, or dance around the office.
sentences.chinese: 放聲歌唱，或者在辦公室裏跳舞。
